title: Synesthesia: The Sensory Dress
detail: an interactive dress that responds to physical gestures controlled by another human
extended_details:
A physical social commentary based on the idea that fashion is dictated by an external source other than by your own creation.
Our project is to create a interactive dress that relies on physical gestures of another human to control the color and form of the dress using OpenCV.  

For example, as the wearer, I would drag my hand horizontally across the front of the dress.  The reaction would be that specific panel of the dress would change color and move in the direction of my movement.  Any sort of "hovering" motion would affect the shape and color of the dress in that section, as if you are painting on yourself in light.

The physical components of the dress are a lightweight linen fabric to counteract the weight of the components, fiberoptic wire to transmit the light around the dress, motors to create a shifting motion (triggered by the gestures), and LED's to create the light. All code will be written in python and powered by a rasberry Pi.
